name: Douglas House

reviews.text: My wife, another couple and myself had booked a vacation package in Florida through Ramada Plaza Resorts. The package included two hotels as well as a short cruise to the Bahamas. Since the first hotel was a dump we decided to leave early and try to find a place in Key West for one night. While enroute, I called the visitor center there and found that they were really no help. We then called the Douglas House from an advertisement in the Travel Guide. Even though we were at the peak of the busy season, we were offered a 900 sq. ft cottage type suite for $299.00. We booked it from the car.
reviews.title: Charming Friendly and Clean
Thank you!
reviews.text: When we got there we found the hotel right on the corner of Amelia and Duval streets. We were walking distance to all of the Duval street attractions, as well as the Southernmost Point Landmark. The staff was courteous and friendly and even made it a point to show us our room before we checked in.

There were absolutely no disappointments here. The building was old and charming. The room was very clean and and painted in bright Caribbean colors. The other rooms in the building were painted in different colors but looked equally as pleasant. The cottage had a kitchenette with a full refrigerator, stove and microwave, as well as a large dining area. There was a half bath and a pull out sofa downstairs. A beautiful hardwood staircase led up to a large loft with an equally large bathroom. The bedroom furniture was all wicker and added to the Caribbean atmosphere. There were also two balconies that overlooked the pool area.
reviews.title: Lovely Place!!!!!!

reviews.text: The hotel has free offstreet parking, two pools, and a free continental breakfast each morning. Our only regret was that we couldn't have stayed longer.
reviews.title: Fantastic!
Great Place for relaxation
reviews.text: This is not a resort with activities and amenities galore. It is a charming little hotel that really captured the flavor of the Keys.

This was my second stay at the Douglas House. This stay was as great as the first, with upgrades. I stayed in a newly renovated room that was very comfortable. The continental breakfast now includes fresh fruit.
reviews.title: Only getting better
Beautiful!
reviews.text: If your looking for an immaculate place to stay in the keys than look no further, The place is impecable! Great location, Ultra freindly staff, Beautiful surroundings and CLEAN!!! Did I say it was clean? You would have thought that the place was just remodeled and you were the first guest staying there, My future wife and I look foward to going back SOON! Carol at the front desk was the most gracious host and she has the most captivating eyes. We stayed at suite # 11. The Continental breakfast was fresh and plentiful, Coffee available 24hrs a day. All in all I give these accomadations * 5 * I * V * E * Stars...

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.text: Just returned from 5 days at the Douglas House B+B in Key West. I stayed across the street from the main house, so I had to cross the street to use the pool. That was no problem. The room was lovely and everything was super clean on the entire property. Parking included, a block away. On the quiet side of Duval St., which was good. The hot tub could have been hotter, but if that is my only complaint I guess that is good. Staff very helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed here several times - mostly in their "sister" hotel, the Cuban Club. Location couldn't be better - right on Duval. Breakfast is very "basic" but otherwise this is a very nice hotel. Staff is helpful and rooms are clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: Great location and decent rates!

likes.disliked: — Stay in the Cuban Club portion of the hotel - better rates and great rooms.

reviews.text: After reading several reviews, I felt obligated to add one for clarity. Simply stated...visitors who have been to Key West before [and love it] will be more than happy at the Douglas House. Service is friendly, competent and accommodating, surrounding area is on "quiet" side of island, although EVERYTHING in Old Town is walkable and the neighborhood is SAFE for anyone who has every left "Mayberry". Price tends to be on the "affordable" end of the spectrum [for Key West] and room decors vary, but at worst; it's simple and comfortable at best more than worth the money! Most rooms have large outdoor balconies or patios (as well as kitchenettes), which are nice for “happy hour” before heading to see the sunset. In reality, the question you have to ask is “how much time do you plan on spending in your room while visiting Key West”. If the answer is: most of your trip, then I suggest the Hilton Key West Marina or better yet…head to Palm Beach.
reviews.title: Ideal Taste for Real Key West Lovers

reviews.text: We stayed at the Douglas House in April, just at the end of the busy season in Key West. The hotel staff did inform us at the time of booking that we were reserving the only room they had left, which was very tiny. They weren't kidding. However, we were informed of this up front, so this is not where I have an issue. My only real complaint with the room is that the walls are so paper thin that I could have had an entire conversation with the guests in the room next to us every time I went to the bathroom...which makes for very little privacy.
reviews.title: Decent but not great

description: A peaceful oasis awaits you in this historic Old Town retreat nestled amid lush gardens. Luxurious, yet affordable, accommodations range from deluxe rooms to comfortable suites and two bedroom, two bath condominiums. Amenities include pool, hot tub, free parking and free continental breakfast daily.
